title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 325-6.8 - Withdrawal of arbitration requests
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 325-6.8 - Withdrawal of arbitration requests

State Regulations

The parties may, by mutual agreement, withdraw the
request for arbitration on a form prescribed by the dispute forum for that
purpose. Such form must be signed by the parties and served on the dispute
forum. If requested by the parties, their agreement to withdraw may be
incorporated in an arbitration award. Additionally, the health insurer may
unilaterally withdraw a request for arbitration by serving such request for
withdrawal on the dispute forum and serving a copy to the other party. Where
the request for arbitration has been withdrawn, fees paid to the dispute forum
shall not be refundable, except as provided in section
325-6.10
(b) of
this Subpart. No request for arbitration may be unilaterally withdrawn unless
the withdrawing party has reimbursed the other party for any non-refundable fee
which such other party has paid to the dispute forum. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
325-6.8

Adopted

New

York State Register April 6, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 14, eff. 6/1/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
